meanings.definition: Unimpressed or indifferent due to overexposure or familiarity.
meanings.sent1: After watching so many action movies, he was blase about the explosions.
meanings.sent2: She seemed blase about the news of the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: The blase cat yawned lazily at the sight of the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her blase attitude towards the award surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The blase expression on his face revealed his lack of interest.

meanings.definition: Bored or uninterested, especially as a result of experiencing too much of something.
meanings.sent1: The students were blase after hearing the same lecture for the third time.
meanings.sent2: He felt blase at the thought of another day of routine tasks.
meanings.sent3: The blase child sighed loudly during the long, boring car ride.
meanings.sent4: Her blase tone indicated she had heard it all before.
meanings.sent5: The blase look in his eyes hinted at his lack of enthusiasm.
